posts.cooked:
I think it would be very useful if users had the option to specify which conversations they’d like to have trimmed via the “Message trimming” setting. Or to be able to specify how many messages to keep per conversation.

I have found that I am fine not trimming messages from certain contacts. But I have a signal group that is very active and I don’t need the all time history of that group. However, if I turn on message trimming, it will trim all conversations to a specified length. It would be nice to have the choice of what conversations get trimmed or not. And/or be able to specify the number to trim to per conversation.

link_counts.title: Clear all messages in DMs and groups
Backups: Why I can't get family and friends onto Signal
Separation of group settings and personal settings for disappearing messages

posts.name: Jo
posts.cooked:
Thanks @chrisddr77,
I like this idea and support for this request.
This is similar to “Disappearing messages” but without a notification to contacts

Situation: I don’t want my phone’s limited internal storage to get completely full with old messages. I am in several noisy group chats for which there is no value to me in keeping the messages stored long-term. However, I have other conversations, where I would like to keep all the messages forever.

The “Settings > Data and storage > Manage storage” section only allows “Keep messages…” to be set globally. I would like to be able to set this per conversation.

mdrake:

“Settings > Data and storage > Manage storage” section only allows “Keep messages…”

I cannot find this setting on iOS. Nevertheless, maybe you are looking for disappearing messages?

M00nD3v:

maybe you are looking for disappearing messages?

Disappearing messages would allow them to emulate the “keep messages” setting on a per-chat basis, but it would also affect their chat partner, who may not have the same preference for removing old messages, so it’s not quite the same.

Indeed, I only want to affect my own local storage of old messages for particular conversations, not affect everyone in the group chat.

I cannot find this setting on iOS. Nevertheless, maybe you are looking for disappearing messages?

Originally I posted this in the Android section, but it got moved here. I’m not sure which version has “trimming” I’ve not seen it on Android Signal.
posts.edit_reason: A post was merged in by Herohtar

posts.cooked: Nevermind, the #feature-requests:android-feature-requests was added to your topic. This feature doesn’t exist on iOS.
I think this idea is great idea!! Would be easy to implement and many people would love this feature!

posts.name: marcode
posts.cooked:
this. very much this.

I can’t think of any other way of trimming a load of crap from groups I don’t want to keep the history for while also keeping the entire history for others.

it’s just one dumb global setting.

there’s no distinction and I am fast running out of space with no way to bin everything older than a year from just a couple groups.

yet again signals incredible UI decisions come to the fore to make it impossible to do the basics.

I’m now stuck with a choice? lose all but a year of all chats? or delete the whole existing offensively large chats.

neither is what I want as a user. I just wanna trim some shite.

Yeah, the app is highly crippled because of their weird ideology issues.

The workaround is for you to go to these chats, go to all media, sort by size or date and delete stuff. Text messages don’t take up much space.

posts.name: marcode
posts.cooked:
have done some of that.

unfortunately, the largest stuff is also the most recent id like to keep.

I’d like a quick way to trim a couple years worth of dog pics tho.

Message history settings shouldn’t apply to your notes. I’d like to be able to keep my notes until I decide I don’t need them anymore, while having message trimming set to 30 days (or a certain quantity). As (I’m assuming) it’s just viewed as a regular conversation where you’re the only party, there’s probably not a way to differentiate it from other conversations.

A possible solution would be a way to group contacts on-device, allowing you to set a group policy for trimming. You could create a group for any conversations you don’t want trimmed, some you want trimmed every 30 days. Maybe if you’re in a bunch of nonsense groups, you can put them in a group that trims every 3 days or 100 messages.

This is a really useful feature. Especially when it comes to Note to self. If we don’t want to add another option because we don’t want too many options, we could at least exclude Note to self from trimming. Note to self already has a special status with other features.

posts.name: Gnrfzui
posts.cooked:
I’m in favor of this suggestion. Like several previous posters, my use case is getting rid of old messages in a few very active groups.

I envision this as a per conversation setting: keep the most recent 100/1000/10.000 messages or keep 1month/6months/1year of history. default keep all (which I desire for all other conversations of mine).

This can help to unclog my backups!

chrononaut:

Message history settings shouldn’t apply to your notes.

Yesss.

chrononaut:

A possible solution would be a way to group contacts on-device, allowing you to set a group policy for trimming. You could create a group for any conversations you don’t want trimmed, some you want trimmed every 30 days. Maybe if you’re in a bunch of nonsense groups, you can put them in a group that trims every 3 days or 100 messages.

This is way to complicated from the UI/UX stand-point IMHO. Setting the trim option manually for those 6 spammy groups should be a reasonable task.

(I wish I’d have that much spammy groups on Signal But they’re all at T because group chats are more feasible there.)

I think that this simple approach would be enough, too. Cleaning up every chat manually is a lot of work and currently I have to backup multiple GB per day (sync Signal backup to external storage). That is possible but not very nice. Limiting just a few chats would be an amazing feature.

Yes ! A per-conversation trim, the same way we yet can customize color/bg and sound/notif (and disappearing messages too, but that we don’t wan’t here as it’s a global setting to the group’s scope) on a per conversation basis.

posts.name: Björn Bause-Engel
posts.cooked:
I just came across this thread and want to express my full support for this idea.

The global “delete messages older than X days” option is useful, but in practice it’s often too coarse. In many cases, I only want to clean up a specific conversation — not all of them. This is especially true for group chats or chats with heavy media usage.

Building on what others have said here, I’d like to propose two complementary options that could be implemented per conversation:

  1. Manual cleanup per chat:
    An option within the chat settings (or chat description) that lets me manually delete all messages older than X days — where X can be chosen from presets (e.g., 7, 30, 90 days) or entered manually. This would only affect that one chat and be a one-time action.

  2. Automatic cleanup per chat:
    In addition, it would be great to enable an automatic, recurring deletion of messages older than X days, but again, limited to that specific conversation. This would function somewhat like a local-only, per-chat version of disappearing messages, without involving the other participant(s) or affecting future messages directly.

Importantly, these features would not require turning on disappearing messages — which is a different use case entirely, as it affects all participants and only applies to future messages.

These cleanup options would give users more granular control over their storage and privacy, without being forced to make global changes or involve others.

Thanks to everyone who raised this before — I really hope the Signal team considers adding per-chat cleanup features like this!
